com.standbysoft.component.date.swing
Class JDateField

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              com.standbysoft.component.date.swing.JDateComponent
                  com.standbysoft.component.date.swing.JDateEditComponent
                      com.standbysoft.component.date.swing.JDateField
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.SwingConstants
public class JDateField
extends JDateEditComponent

A date field is a plain implementation for a date edit component. You can find task-oriented documentation and examples of using date fields in Using the JDateField Component, a section in The Java Date Picker Tutorial.

There are no extra operations added to it, so everything one would need to know to use it is specified in JDateEditComponent.

The default UI delegate used by this component is BasicDateFieldUI. When using this delegate, the component can be configured with some client properties that improve its behavior.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

JDateField

public JDateField()
Creates a default date field that has the today date selected. Null dates are allowed by default.
